page.title: 08BARNS - HURSTBOURNE TARRANT
page.content: There are some beautiful thatched { barns in {Hurstbourne Tarrant}and{ {Ibthorpe.} At Parsonage Farm next to the church, there is a{Tudor granary}standing on staddle stones. It is unusual because it has a pigeon loft. There are also two large barns with oak timbers on which the following dates are carved:- 1735, 1737, 1780, 1798, 1799. One is an{aisle barn}with free standing oak posts supporting the roof. Barns were used as village meeting places, and the aisle barn at{Ibthorpe Manor Farm is still used in this way. Each summer a party of blind people from{Andover}come to a concert in the{ barn given by local schoolchildren. In September 1985 the village{Flower Show will also be held in this aisle barn for the first time.
